snippet: The fighting in the Lebanese town of Arsal appeared to be the worst spillover into Lebanon since the Syrian conflict began more than three years ago.
abstract: Fighting between Lebanon's armed forces and Islamist insurgents from Syria worsens in most serious spillover of Syrian civil war in Lebanese territory to date; Lebanese Army counts its casualties from three days of fighting at 14 soldiers killed, 86 wounded and 22 missing; more than 20 Islamist fighters are also believed to be among those killed, but it is impossible to determine precise numbers.

byline.original: By HWAIDA SAAD and RICK GLADSTONE
byline.contributor: Hwaida Saad reported from Beirut, and Rick Gladstone from New York.

lead_paragraph: The fighting in the Lebanese town of Arsal appeared to be the worst spillover into Lebanon since the Syrian conflict began more than three years ago.

headline.main: Border Fighting Intensifies Between ISIS and Lebanon
headline.print_headline: Border Fighting Intensifies Between ISIS and Lebanon

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
